content: Ong is a surname of Chinese origin, and it is one of the most common surnames among ethnic Chinese people. The name is spelled "Wang" in Mandarin Chinese and "Ong" in Hokkien dialect. The name is derived from the Chinese character "王," which means "king" or "monarch." The surname Ong is most commonly found in China, Taiwan, Malaysia, Singapore, and other countries with significant ethnic Chinese populations. It has been borne by several notable individuals throughout history, including politicians, businessmen, and scholars.
